title: Amazing Rice Farming Techniques of Vietnam

tasks.task: Load soil from a truck into a spreader.
subtasks: Approach the truck carrying soil.
Open the gate or door of the truck to access the soil.
Reach into the truck and scoop soil using a shovel or similar tool.
Carry the loaded shovel of soil to the spreader.
Open the hopper or release mechanism of the spreader.
Carefully pour or dump the soil into the spreader's hopper.
Close the hopper or release mechanism securely.
Step back to a safe distance from the spreader.
Approach the spreader with necessary tools.
Prime the spreader if required (e.g., add fuel, lubricate).
Adjust the spreading width or pattern to desired coverage.
Lift the discharge or spreader mechanism to the appropriate height.
Start the spreader's engine or activating mechanism.
Test the spreader operation to ensure it is moving soil smoothly.
Begin moving the spreader to the field, driving or pulling it as needed.
Monitor the spread pattern and adjust spreader settings or position as needed during operation.
Stop the spreader, disengage the spreader mechanism, and shut it down at the end of use.
Identify the field or area needing nutrient verification.
Collect soil samples from various points in the field using a sampling tool.
Send the soil samples to a laboratory for nutrient analysis.
Review the lab results for nutrient levels and assess whether additional soil amendments are required.

tasks.task: Apply the spreader to distribute soil amendments across a field.
subtasks: Assemble the spreader following manufacturer instructions.
Weigh out the necessary soil amendments (e.g., compost, fertilizer).
Load the amendments into the spreader's hopper.
Secure the hopper lid to prevent spillage.
Check if the spreader's attachments (like the auger or gravity dump) are functioning.
Align the spreader with the starting point of the field.
Start the spreader and monitor the distribution of the amendments.
Ensure even coverage by adjusting speed or spreading rate as needed.
Stop the spreader at the end and clean up any residue.

tasks.task: Apply a spreader behind a tractor to distribute manure or compost.
subtasks: Attach the spreader to the rear of the tractor using the hitch.
Check the attachment points for stability and proper hitch engagement.
Make sure the spreader’s turntable or pivot point is correctly set.
Connect power take-off (PTO) if the spreader is PTO-driven.
Start the tractor and engage PTO if applicable.
Drive the tractor and spreader in a straight line across the field.
Adjust the speed of the tractor to control the spread rate.
Monitor the distribution to check for clumps or uneven coverage, and make necessary adjustments.
Immediately after spreading, check for any areas that require reapplication.
Detach the spreader from the tractor and store it properly.

tasks.task: Check the spreader hopper for blockages or proper loading.
subtasks: Examine the hopper for any obstructions from previous loads.
Clear any debris or clogs blocking the hopper openings.
Check the depth of the soil or amendment layer in the hopper.
Ensure the material is not overfilled, which can lead to uneven spreading.
Check the side ejector or other discharge mechanisms for proper operation.

tasks.task: Ensure the spreader's spreader mechanism is properly aligned and set.
subtasks: Align the spreader’s gauge wheels or track rollers with the ground surface.
Inspect the spreader mechanism’s hydraulic or mechanical linkage to the tractor.
Check angle adjusters or spread wings for even material distribution.
Calibrate the spreader by adjusting the discharge angle or speed.

tasks.task: Troubleshoot issues with the spreader which may stop spreading when moving.
subtasks: Check the spreader's power source (electric or PTO-driven) to ensure it is functioning.
Verify that the spreader's hopper is not empty or too light, which could cause low speed issues.
Inspect the spreader's agitator or motor to check for faults.
Look for any clogs in the discharge mechanism that might block material flow.
Check the hydraulic system if applicable, ensuring proper fluid levels and leaks.
